Lesson.Title: This is a second title and should come after the text after the simulation

Content.Block: This is a larger block with more things on it spam spam spam blah blah blah asldkjflasdlkjvlskjlksdjkc.d dsjflsd kdslds fdslsdkl fsd fds lksdj.

In many day-to-day circumstances, velocity and speed are interchangable words. Velocity, is the change in position over the change in time, Δx/Δt. The character delta "Δ" is the greek character for d, in the scientific community, Δ means change.

To calculus students, this concept should be very familliar. Here's an example: if a ball moves 5 meters to the right every 2 seconds, Δx = 5 meters, and Δt = 2 seconds. Therefore, Δx/Δt = 5m/2s = 2.5 meters per second, the ball is moving at a speed of 2.5 meters per second.
